2 bed flat for sale

Triangle Court, Camberwell New Road, London. SE5

Interested in this property? Call 020 3641 4606 or Request Details

Property features

  • Two Bedroom New Build Apartment
  • Excellent Transport Links
  • 977 Square Feet Internally
  • Two Bathrooms (One En-suite)
  • Ample Storage Throughout and Built In Wardrobes
  • Open Plan Living With Hardwood Oak Flooring
  • High Specification Throughout
  • Brand New 250 Year Lease
  • Communal Courtyard & Lift To All Floors

Property description

Open day Saturday 11th May (By Appointment Only): Apartment 7 - A fantastic penthouse apartment (apartment 30 on the floor plan) comprising of two bedrooms, two bathrooms (one en-suite), private roof terrace, a 250 year lease, private balcony and 977 sq ft internally.

Triangle Court is an exceptional development, comprising a stunning range of 1,2 and 3 bedroom contemporary apartments. Employing both modern aesthetics and traditional craftsmanship, sympathetically and meticulously designed and constructed, they provide spacious accommodation with great storage space.

Each flat benefits from a 10 year build warranty, a 250 year lease, CCTV and video entry system. The superb specification includes Bosch appliances throughout, hardwood oak flooring, and fitted wardrobes to principal bedrooms, with shelf and rail.

The Location
In the heart of Camberwell, it offers considerable investment potential with excellent transport links, easy access to all key areas of the city and beyond, and a vibrant local environment that has been, and continues to be, regenerated. There are numerous restaurants and a growing cafe culture, pedestrianisation of nearby streets and the redevelopment of a large number of properties make Camberwell an increasingly attractive address.

The Schools
Surrounded by green spaces and set within a welcoming environment, Camberwell is conveniently located for families. There are many nurseries nearby, and a choice of primary schools with superb reputations within easy walking distance. These include Lyndhurst and Dog Kennel Hill. For those with slightly older children there is also a number of secondary schools including Dulwich College, James Allen's Girls School and Allen's, all with unrivalled reputations in the private sector. For those who wish to continue their education, many of London's renowned universities and colleges are also within easy reach.

Out and About
Camberwell offers a mix of diverse tastes and experiences with many international restaurants and a lively cafe and bar scene particularly during the summer 'Camberwell Arts Festival'. Local shops and supermarkets include high-street favourites as well as specialist outlets and if you're feeling active there's Camberwell Leisure Centre with its beautiful Victorian pool, sports hall and gym facilities right on your doorstep.

Getting Around
Denmark Hill connects directly to Victoria and Kings Cross Stations. It is now on the new London orbital rail route opening up transport links across the Capital with direct links to Shoreditch, Canada Water and Clapham Junction .
Oval Tube Station (Northern Line) also within walking distance presents an alternative route via train with direct routes to London Bridge, Old Street, Kings Cross and Tottenham Court Road amongst many other destinations.

There are a number of bus routes providing direct access to London Bridge, Waterloo, Westminster, Victoria, Oxford Circus and Euston. When it comes to driving, it is just a short drive to the south circular, or to the main routes north out of London. For those travelling further afield, there are excellent rail and bus links to airports including Gatwick, City and Heathrow, as well as to the new Eurostar terminal at King's Cross St Pancras.

Local authority

Southwark

Estimated tax band D Council tax cost £121 /month
when paid over 10 months
Council tax costs explained

The Council Tax cost displayed is based on the council tax band and on the basis of 2 adults living at the property. The monthly cost shown excludes any discounts and is rounded to the nearest pound.

Full information on Council Tax discount entitlements can be found on the Gov.UK’s website.

Water Supply £13 Sewerage £13 Estimated water cost £26 /month
Water costs explained

Water consumption is based on average water usage for the predicted occupancy of the property based on the number of bedrooms.

Total annual consumption (in cubic meters) is then averaged into a monthly cost.

Note: If you have 2 separate suppliers for water and sewage, you may receive 2 separate bills.
